hypothesis_content.title: Leverage Flush Amplification at Key Technical Levels
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/STRESS regimes, when BTC approaches major round-number levels ($85K, $90K) with estimated aggregate leverage >$3B within 2%, a break of these levels triggers 2-3x normal volatility as cascading liquidations amplify the move, with stronger effects when funding rates are extreme (>0.03% or <-0.02%).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Round numbers attract concentrated leverage as traders place stops. When broken, liquidations create forced selling/buying, amplified by high leverage. Current $87K price between $85K/$90K key levels with elevated leverage creates setup for such event.
entry_conditions: BTC within 2% of major round number ($85K or $90K currently)
Estimated aggregate leverage >$3B near that level
4-hour candle closes beyond level with >1.5% move

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move beyond level OR estimated leverage drops by >40%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 12 hours post-break OR next major level reached

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Break of key level with high nearby leverage produces normal volatility (<1.5x average), indicating liquidation cascades are not amplifying moves.
